course.subject: BIEN
course.name: Application of Engineering in Life Science
course.description: This course is designed as an introductory course in biomedical engineering. The aim of this course is to present some of the basic science and human physiology knowledge used by biomedical engineers and illustrates the first steps in applying this knowledge to solve problems in human medicine. The second goal of this course is to link knowledge of basic science and engineering to fields of specialization and current research. This course also introduces the sub-specialties in biomedical engineering and through real-life examples to emphasize the types of problems biomedical engineers solve.

reviews.author: biochemisttt
reviews.comment_content: The content is not that easy overall. I was studying biology and physics in high school and I do know the content related  to biology. It is simple as it talks about kidney functions and heartbeat etc. But it is really hard to understand those formulae and how to apply. No example to explain those formulae in the powerpoint and no detailed explaination in the lesson either.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Hsing's ppt is more easy to understand. It is easy to catch up if u attend lessons.
Chau's ppt is simple but the hw is very difficult and u wont know how to do. She only explain the hw very briefly and quickly in an extra tutorial lesson apart from normal lectures.

Apart from the lectures, you need to use wikispace for doing the project. Although it does offer you a compulsory workshop to learn how to use this shit, it is not user-friendly. Not easy to use at all. I nearly send email to ask the TA every single question like how to check my title, how to watch other projects etc. Luckily the TA is very patient to answer my idiot questions.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading should be average. Both my midterm and final below about a sd and I did the project so hea so I got a C.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload was more than I imagined.
5-6 assignments with short questions and long questions but it only contributes to 5% of the final grade but very difficult and demanding. It takes you hours to finish and still you may not know how to solve.
A project that need to choose topic reference but I was offered to a topic that I do not have any interest  in it so I did it so hea. Moreover, I have a friend who missed the project deadline which do not have marks deducted and I think this is really unfair. Nevertheless, if you score high in the project, you will be invited to give a presentation to the class.
Mid-term exam is a close-book exam and if study hardworkingly, you will get a good mark.
Final exam is a nightmare. Although it is an open-book exam, you will use too much time in finding notes and do not have enough time for finishing the whole paper. Even if you know how to calculate in Chau's homework, you won't know how to calculate the super hard questions in the exam. I remember I can only answer the content related to Bio but nothing about the formulae part.

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.title: Don't be deceived by peers
reviews.comment_content:
Many claimed that this course is very easy to ace. These are all false, at least to me, a student who is not adept at physics.

All topics are related to advanced physics and include hell lots of maths which is as demanding as that taught to engineering students instead of what is stated in its course introduction that this course also "caters" for students without science background.

Fluid Dynamics? Bernoulli's Equations? Fick's Law? XXX Flow......?

I am so sorry that I am too stupid to understand these. Maybe some dudes may find them interesting and easy to get the hang of them.

Well, I don't try to slander this course and discourage every junior undergraduate from registering it, but what I want to say is, think THRICE, NOT just twice, if you plan to register this course to fulfill Common Core's S&T requirement.
reviews.comment_teaching: Hsing taught quite well, but Prof. Chau......Needless to imply.
reviews.comment_grading:
I skipped the final exam due to my inability to understand the things and before which I had already performed very poorly in Mid-Term by having been lower than the mean for as many as 25 marks.

I was still granted a "D", amounting to grade points of 3.0 equivalent to the credits this course carries.

Profs are lenient in grading. Ha.
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework every week. Very stressful.

For the individual project requiring you to write about a technology they would assign to you on Wikispace, well......I did complete it, but was fearful of looking at the mark or peer comments on it as I simply jettisoned this course following which I didn't even take the final.

Yea, this was sort of a suicidal act. Sometimes, you have no choice. That's life.

reviews.author: savi123
reviews.comment_content:
1.Monitoring of Body Temperature, Heart Beat and Blood Pressure.
2.Physiology and Mechanics about Breathing
3.Understand and Monitor Your Blood Oxygen
4.Tracking your health everywhere
5.Medical Image

After midterm
6.From mass balance to the design of extracorporeal
7.Engineering Immunity
8.Drug delivery, Tissue Engineering and Biomaterial

Just briefly introuduce each topics.
It is just a 2000- level course. Don't expect you can learn much.
reviews.comment_teaching:
They were nice and tried to interact with the student.

However, the pace of teaching was too slow. and almost the first 20 minutes of every lesson were reviewing the previous lecture....... ( perhaps 9 am class and waiting for the student to come)
reviews.comment_grading:
Home Work 10 %
Midterm 35 %
Final exam35 %
Individual Project20 % (15% wikispace project page and 5% student interaction)

I held in all homework, midterm scores above mean 1SD, the individual project is not listed as the top 5, final exam result not released.                            
Received an A
reviews.comment_workload:
There were 6 pieces of homework, quite difficult,
The content might not be covered in the lecture notes, so you need to search the Internet.
Homework was graded depends on your effort, not accuracy. It is fine even your answers are wrong = )

The wikispace page took me 2 whole days to complete. Prior to this, it spent me some time to decide the topic.
Comment on 5 peers project, and you can get 5% already.
Not very demanding...
However, by the end of the semester, you would face many project deadline...

Final: Only the lecture after midterm would be examined,
it was an open book exam, we could bring the lecture notes and homework.
The exam is difficult, but the lecture notes helped!

Midterm was a closed book exam. Attend the class and pay attention. He might give hints for the midterm.

reviews.author: Martin.Y.K.Chan
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting but sometime too complicated and the powerpoint sometimes unclear. Some of the content is quite new to us. Although there are part of the students who are not majoring in science or engineering, the content is not easy at all. So, student with no scientific background is not recommended to take this course
reviews.comment_teaching: The first Prof. English is not that good. Sometimes, it's hard to understand the content.
reviews.comment_grading: Normal Grading. Assignment, Individual Project, Two exams
reviews.comment_workload: We need to create a wikispace, a platform that I guess only a few of us has used before. This wikispace has no difference from writing an essay. So I would say this wikispace is just adding pointless workload to the students

reviews.author: Cherman
reviews.comment_content:
CONTENT :
basic medical device's application
not too difficult :)!
homework and projects are similar to the topic taught in class. Easy to manage!
reviews.comment_teaching:
TEACHING :
Intructor will provide ard 2-3 revision lessons.
Must attend!!!!!!!!!!!! and instructor is very nice and patient to answer out questions :)
reviews.comment_grading:
GRADING :
Not too bad and easy to get good grade since have 2-3 revision lessons to help us revise and have cheat sheet to assist.

and homework and assignment are easy to attain 80% grading~ so no worries la!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
WORKLOAD :
1 group project (during lecture)
2 assignmentss (1 individual; 1 group)

reviews.author: Kim Yiu
reviews.title: BIEN 2010
reviews.comment_content:
教一Ｄ medical device 的應用，不算太深入，可以輕鬆應付
功課/project主要圍繞上堂教的知識，不太難
reviews.comment_teaching: instructor 很好人，mid-term/final 前有一兩堂係同你review questions, D問題好多都係考試到考番，所以溫書堂一定要去
reviews.comment_grading:
grade 唔差，始終有溫書堂同cheat sheet 幫你
功課同project 好易有90% 分數
reviews.comment_workload:
1 group project(to be completed during lecture)
2 assignment(1 individual; 1 group assignment)

reviews.author: calister
reviews.comment_content:
主要喺講一d medical devices嘅原理同埋點用
個人覺得若有dse水平嘅phys同bio底就比較容易理解
但dse無讀phys同bio都唔緊要
我自己dse無讀bio無讀phys
唔識嘅就youtube，google睇翻
最後個grade都ok
reviews.comment_teaching:
carrie教得唔錯啦。
臨考midterm final之前都有一兩堂同我地review翻
大部分考試嘅題目都喺距幫我地review嘅問題
所以review過堂都幾重要
carrie都幾鐘意同學生互動，所以上堂都唔會好悶
距份人都幾nice，特地開左堂tutor班俾d無phys底嘅學生
reviews.comment_grading:
有兩份assignments一份group project
全部都有90+/100
midterm高過mean幾分
final就唔知啦
最後有B+
可以帶cheat sheet，一頁A4紙
考d野都幾細
reviews.comment_workload:
兩份assignments一份自己做，一份group一齊做
個group喺assigned嘅，無得揀group mates
仲有一份group project
喺堂上做，喺要設計改良d medical device
有份一頁紙嘅report即堂交，唔算難

reviews.author: joker
reviews.comment_content:
Quite useful as the principles of some medical devices and some new technology are learnt.
You just have to understand the content and recite all. It is not that hard to understand.
You will have advantage if you studied physics and biology in high school. If you didn't, just memorize all the things and go to midterm and final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Carrie is super good. Her English is understandable. She is willing to answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading: I heard that the mean is around B so it should be a good grade course among UST.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 2 easy assignments and 1 group project.
A lot to recite before final exam as the cheatsheet is only one page.

reviews.comment_content: i really like the content in this course. We study about bioengineering technology, body structures and a small part involves physics knowledge. Being a student with no physics background, it's a bit difficult to understand but professor is very willing to explain it again and again.
reviews.comment_teaching: Carrie is nice and cute. She is patient in explaining the theories and course content. Really appreciated the extra tutorial session before final exams for students who are super confused like me lol there are group discussions during class but it doesnt contribute to grade :)
reviews.comment_grading: Single-paged handwritten cheatsheet helped a lot. as long as you copied the content from ppt onto ur cheatsheet, getting a good grade shouldnt be a big problem.
reviews.comment_workload: Only one to two simple assignments. A relatively troublesome thing would be the project. But overall the course is really hing sung.

reviews.author: KL
reviews.comment_content: instructor會係ppt特登hide咗d野等你上堂翻去抄notes。ppt圖片居多，唔去聽真係唔知佢講乜。內容多，但算係條例清晰。讀過1902同physics會有著數。
reviews.comment_teaching: Instructor好鍾意叫人答問題（有時點名），同埋會記得某d人ge名。但有d位我覺得instructor自己都唔係好識d內容=。=
reviews.comment_grading: 上堂唔認真聽又無bio/phy底就GG。而且考試會出d細節一定要上過堂先識。可以帶A4單面手寫cheatsheet
reviews.comment_workload: 會分組做assignment，不過assignment都係幾條問題，好少野做。主要workload係midterm/final前做cheatsheet…
